title: Rail strikes and flight cancellations: Are UK travellers heading for a summer of misery?
description: After two years of Covid rules, airline disruption and rail strikes risk overshadowing the summer.

title: 'I am completely besotted with this pigeon'
description: An NHS worker's videos with her feathered friend have had 22m views on social media.

title: Week in pictures: 4 - 10 June 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Emma Thompson and Daryl McCormack star in Good Luck To You, Leo Grande
description: Dame Emma Thompson on her 'brave' sexy new role in new film Good Luck To You, Leo Grande.

title: Ms: The first magazine owned, run, and written by women
description: Ms Magazine covered issues such as equal rights, abortion and domestic violence in a way that no other magazine had before.

title: Justin Bieber reveals facial paralysis after shows cancelled
description: The pop star posted a video to Instagram to show how only half of his face could move.

title: Putin and Peter the Great: Russian leader likens himself to 18th Century tsar
description: With a nod to history, Putin now feels bold enough to admit that his operation is an occupation.

title: Rwanda asylum: Iranian policeman who defied orders says he fears for his life
description: An Iranian policeman set to be deported under the UK's new scheme says his life will be in danger.

title: Worried households cut back on energy and food
description: Official data reveals heightened concern among households about the rising cost of living.

title: Families of condemned Britons Aiden Aslin and Shaun Pinner call for help
description: Aiden Aslin and Shaun Pinner were sentenced to death by a Russian proxy court in Ukraine on Thursday.

title: Billy Bingham: Former Northern Ireland manager dies at the age of 90
description: Billy Bingham, who managed Northern Ireland at the 1982 and 1986 World Cup finals, dies at the age of 90.

title: Boy, 14, stabbed to death and mother hurt in Manchester
description: Police search for an Asian man who was known to the victims after the "ferocious" attack in Manchester.

title: Sergio Perez fastest in Azerbaijan Grand Prix first practice
description: Red Bull's Sergio Perez continues his strong form with fastest time in first practice at the Azerbaijan Grand Prix.

title: Rwanda asylum plan: Home Office fights bid to block flight
description: Lawyers tell the High Court the plan is valid and in the public interest and must go ahead.

title: Jurassic World Dominion: 'Joyless' film franchise finale mauled by critics
description: The final film in the Jurassic World trilogy shows it is "time for this franchise to go extinct".

title: Thousands ride into town for Appleby Horse Fair
description: More than 30,000 people are expected to gather for the traditional Gypsy and traveller festival.

title: Neighbours cast say farewell on TV soap's last day of filming
description: Stars of the long-running Australian show say the final day of filming is "incredibly emotional".

title: F1 stars say they will continue to speak out
description: Lewis Hamilton and Sebastian Vettel say they will continue to speak out on issues despite FIA president Mohammed Ben Sulayem questioning whether drives should "impose their beliefs" on others.

title: Russia's new version of McDonald's unveils logo
description: It comes as the fast food chain is due to reopen 15 of the rebranded restaurants this weekend.

title: Refineries cash in as petrol prices soar
description: A lack of capacity to process crude oil has helped to drive fuel prices to record levels

title: Britney Spears marries Sam Asghari after ex-husband Jason Alexander gatecrashes
description: The singer ties the knot to Sam Asghari as first husband Jason Alexander is arrested for trespassing.

title: Wiltshire Police say otters are killing expensive pet fish
description: Corsham Police force suggests people use either welded mesh to cover the pond or erect a wire fence.

title: Chris Mason: Can weakened Johnson turn things around?
description: The prime minister tries to tackle the rising cost of living while grappling with leadership challenges.

title: Shipwreck The Gloucester hailed most important since Mary Rose
description: Details of the royal wreck are revealed for the first time after it was found by divers 15 years ago.

title: Chris Packham in row over wildflower cutting
description: The TV presenter criticises a council after an area of wildflowers is cut down in Derbyshire.

title: Cost of living has left Stoke woman with little money for food
description: People working and visiting the Whitfield Valley Centre speak about the rising cost of bills.

title: January 6 hearing: Trump accused of attempted coup
description: A hearing shows clips of the ex-president's daughter and aides saying his claim of voter fraud was false.

title: UFC 275: How samurai code turned Jiri Prochazka into title challenger
description: Jiri Prochazka tells BBC Sport about his journey from football hooliganism to samurai to challenging Glover Teixeira for the light-heavyweight title at UFC 275 on Saturday.

title: Schoolgirls who became Scotland's first female firefighters
description: Three women recall their experiences attending call-outs in the 1970s, when only men could join the fire service.

title: Transgender Sussex paramedic says patients refuse her help
description: Steph Meech has been spat at and verbally abused by patients she has treated.

title: Bear fight on cliff-edge ends in deadly fall
description: A female bear was forced to protect her cub from a male in Spain's Cantabrian mountains.

title: Tooting library waives 48-year fine after book returned from Canada
description: The book, borrowed from a south London library in 1974, had racked up thousands of pounds in fines.

title: Premier League transfer window opens - who could be on move this summer?
description: The Premier League transfer window opens with clubs able to officially register summer signings.

title: My Name Is Leon: Sir Lenny Henry brings moving adoption story to screen
description: The actor and comedian on why he wanted to make a TV version of Kit de Waal's novel My Name Is Leon.

title: Pet owners forced to give up reptiles over costs
description: More animals surrendered in the first three months of the year than in the whole of 2021.

title: Elephant tusk ivory sold on eBay a decade after self-imposed ban
description: Sellers simply call ivory by other names including 'bovine bone', investigation shows.
